result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J Espeseth in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF234 and 15CF246. 
Restitution has been paid and victim impact panel has been completed. 2:48 case in recess to go over plea questionnaire.3:53 case recalled. 
15CF246 - State moves to dismiss. Court orders case be dismissed and read-in. 
15CF234 - State moves to amend 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a). Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. VIS filed. 

Court relates and orders: 
Costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

Clerked by AP 
Defendant Daniel J Espeseth in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF234 AND 15CF246

Daniel has paid diversion court fee.
Daniel has been making his agreed upon payments.
Daniel is waiting to see if other party wishes to participate into Victim Offender Conference.
Continue paying on restitution, and complete Restorative Justice - Victim Offender Conference by 1/07/16.
Defense moves for bond to be amended to change "no contact with Heidi and Garrett S" to "no contact with Heidi or Garrett S, except for Victim Offender Conferencing through Restorative Justice"  All other conditions of previous bond to remain in full force and effect.  Court grants motion.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191. 
 Must have no contact with Garrett S, Heidi S by any means.  
 Must not come within 300 feet of Garrett and Heidi S residence.

AMENDED 11/19/15:  No contact with Garrett S and Heidi S is amended to no contact with Heidi or Garrett S except for Victim Offender Conferencing through Restorative Justice.  All other conditions of previous bond remain in full force and effect.

Clerked by AP. 
Defendant Daniel J Espeseth in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF234 AND 15CF246

Defendant has entered into a Diversion Court Agreement in both above cases.
Pay $50 Diversion Court Fee to DA's office by 10/26/15 at 4:00 PM
Court puts Diversion Court agreement on the record.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Espeseth in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF234 and 15CF246. 
Formal reading of Informations waived. Not guilty pleas entered to all counts in both cases.
